head.title: Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting

ing.item: Apples; diced (I like granny smiths and they needn't be peeled)

directions.step:
From: pasquale@lanl.gov (Gina Pasquale)
Date: 21 Apr 1994 19:04:51 -0400 I have enjoyed this newsgroup immensely. I've gotten so many good recipes from postings that I thought I'd post one of my favorites. This came from a newspaper many years ago, and I always get compliments when I make it.
Beat eggs until light & fluffy. Gradually add in sugar, oil & vanilla. Sift together flour, salt, soda, cinnamon & nutmeg (I don't sift, just mix); add to first mixture. Stir in apples & walnuts. Place in greased 9x13" pan. Bake in 350 deg. oven for 45 min. or until center springs back when touched. Allow to cool in pan on a rack for 15 min; spread with Cream Cheese Frosting (recipe follows).
CREAM CHEESE FROSTING: Beat cream cheese and butter together. Add vanilla and beat. Gradually beat in powdered sugar until smooth.
Note: Both cake and frosting freeze well.
